intro: Canthium sidamense, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is typically found in moist, shaded areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Canthium sidamense is also known for its toxic properties, making it a plant to be handled with care.
